wikipedia_page.main: Raine Spencer, Countess Spencer (née McCorquodale; 9 September 1929 – 21 October 2016) was a British socialite and local politician. She was the daughter of Alexander McCorquodale and the romantic novelist and socialite Dame Barbara Cartland and the stepmother of Diana, Princess of Wales.

response: * May 30 – Charles, Prince of Wales, in a speech to the Royal Institute of British Architects denounces the proposed modernist Hampton Extension to the National Gallery in London designed by Peter Ahrends as "a hideous carbuncle on the face of an elegant and much-loved friend", declaring his reactionary views on architecture for the first time. The phrase "hideous carbuncle" was originated by his step-mother-in-law Raine Spencer, Countess Spencer, in The Spencers on Spas (1983) p. 14.
* Raine Spencer, Countess Spencer (born 1929), step-mother of Lady Diana, Princess of Wales

Count Jean-François Pineton de Chambrun, the third husband of Raine Spencer, Countess Spencer, is also a descendant of Gilbert and Adrienne Motier de La Fayette.Ancestors of Jean-François Pineton de Chambrun
* Raine Spencer, Countess Spencer (1929–2016), stepmother of Lady Diana Frances Spencer

Whiteway was offered for sale in 1973.Listed Buildings text In 2000 Whiteway was purchased with 281 acres by Raine Spencer, Countess Spencer (1929-2016), who had married as her first husband Gerald Legge, 9th Earl of Dartmouth (d. 1997), from whom she was divorced in 1976. The estate was being operated in 2002 by her son William Legge, 10th Earl of Dartmouth (born 1949) for commercial deer-stalking.Daily Telegraph 18 October 2002
* Raine Spencer, Countess Spencer (1929–2016), British socialite, stepmother of Diana, Princess of Wales
